title: Research
description: My research focuses on machine learning algorithms for brain-computer interface systems, particularly EEG-based P300 Speller technology, and other areas of AI/ML.

items.title: Subject-independent P300 Speller Classification using Time-Frequency Representation and Double Input CNN with Feature Concatenation
items.authors: Zangar Ermaganbet, Ayana Mussabayeva, Muhammad Tahir Akhtar, Prashant Kumar Jamwal
items.description: This paper presents a novel approach to P300 speller classification using a double input CNN architecture that concatenates features for improved accuracy in subject-independent scenarios.
items.citation: Z. Ermaganbet, A. Mussabayeva, M. T. Akhtar, P. K. Jamwal, "Subject-independent P300 speller classification using time-frequency representation and double input CNN with feature concatenation," 2023 IEEE International Conference on Digital Signal Processing (DSP), pp. 1-5, 2023.

items.title: Event-related spectrogram representation of EEG for CNN-based P300 speller
items.authors: Ayana Mussabayeva, Muhammad Tahir Akhtar, Prashant Kumar Jamwal
items.description: This research explores the use of event-related spectrograms as a representation method for EEG signals in CNN-based P300 speller systems.
items.citation: A. Mussabayeva, M. T. Akhtar, P. K. Jamwal, "Event-related spectrogram representation of EEG for CNN-based P300 speller," 2021 Asia-Pacific Signal and Information Processing Association Annual Summit and Conference (APSIPA ASC), pp. 1267-1272, 2021.

items.title: Ensemble learning approach for subject-independent P300 speller
items.authors: Ayana Mussabayeva, Muhammad Tahir Akhtar, Prashant Kumar Jamwal
items.description: This paper proposes an ensemble learning approach to improve the accuracy and robustness of subject-independent P300 speller systems.
items.citation: A. Mussabayeva, M. T. Akhtar, P. K. Jamwal, "Ensemble learning approach for subject-independent P300 speller," 2021 43rd Annual International Conference of the IEEE Engineering in Medicine & Biology Society (EMBC), pp. 6629-6632, 2021.

items.title: Ensemble Voting-Based Multichannel EEG Classification in a Subject-Independent P300 Speller
items.authors: Ayana Mussabayeva, Muhammad Tahir Akhtar, Prashant Kumar Jamwal
items.description: This study presents an ensemble voting-based approach for multichannel EEG classification in subject-independent P300 speller systems.
items.citation: A. Mussabayeva, M. T. Akhtar, P. K. Jamwal, "Ensemble Voting-Based Multichannel EEG Classification in a Subject-Independent P300 Speller," Applied Sciences, vol. 11, no. 23, p. 11252, 2021.

items.title: Comparison of Generic and Subject-Specific Training for Features Classification in P300 Speller
items.authors: Ayana Mussabayeva, Muhammad Tahir Akhtar, Prashant Kumar Jamwal
items.description: This research compares the effectiveness of generic and subject-specific training approaches for feature classification in P300 speller systems.
items.citation: A. Mussabayeva, M. T. Akhtar, P. K. Jamwal, "Comparison of Generic and Subject-Specific Training for Features Classification in P300 Speller," 2020 Asia-Pacific Signal and Information Processing Association Annual Summit and Conference (APSIPA ASC), pp. 1105-1110, 2020.

items.title: Brain-Computer Interfaces
items.description: Developing machine learning algorithms for EEG-based brain-computer interface systems, with a focus on P300 speller technology.

items.title: Deep Learning
items.description: Exploring novel deep learning architectures for signal processing and classification tasks.

items.title: Medical AI
items.description: Investigating medical applications of AI for neural disorders, such as Alzheimer's disease.

items.title: Causality in ML
items.description: Investigating causal relationships in machine learning models and their applications.
